verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great company, and camels that bare spices, and gold in abundance, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she communed with him of all that was in her heart.
verses.web: When the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to test Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great caravan, including camels that bore spices, gold in abundance, and precious stones. When she had come to Solomon, she talked with him about all that was in her heart.
verses.ct: When the queen of Sheba heard about Solomon's fame, she traveled to Jerusalem to test him with difficult questions. She arrived with an enormous caravan — camels loaded with spices, massive amounts of gold, and precious stones. When she met with Solomon, she talked with him about everything on her mind.

verses.kjv: And Solomon told her all her questions: and there was nothing hid from Solomon which he told her not.
verses.web: Solomon answered all her questions. There wasn’t anything hidden from Solomon which he didn’t tell her.
verses.ct: Solomon answered every one of her questions. Nothing was too complex for him — he explained it all.

verses.kjv: And when the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, and the house that he had built,
verses.web: When the queen of Sheba had seen the wisdom of Solomon, the house that he had built,
verses.ct: When the queen of Sheba had witnessed Solomon's wisdom firsthand, seen the palace he had built,

verses.kjv: And the meat of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their apparel; his cupbearers also, and their apparel; and his ascent by which he went up into the house of the LORD; there was no more spirit in her.
verses.web: the food of his table, the seating of his servants, the attendance of his ministers, their clothing, his cup bearers also, their clothing, and his ascent by which he went up to LORD’s house; there was no more spirit in her.
verses.ct: the food served at his table, the seating arrangements for his officials, the way his attendants served and the fine clothing they wore, his cupbearers in their robes, and the stairway he used to go up to the LORD's house — she was completely overwhelmed.

verses.kjv: And she said to the king, It was a true report which I heard in mine own land of thine acts, and of thy wisdom:
verses.web: She said to the king, “It was a true report that I heard in my own land of your acts and of your wisdom.
verses.ct: She said to the king, "Everything I heard back in my own country about your accomplishments and your wisdom was true.

verses.kjv: Howbeit I believed not their words, until I came, and mine eyes had seen it: and, behold, the one half of the greatness of thy wisdom was not told me: for thou exceedest the fame that I heard.
verses.web: However I didn’t believe their words until I came, and my eyes had seen it; and behold half of the greatness of your wisdom wasn’t told me. You exceed the fame that I heard!
verses.ct: I didn't believe any of it until I came and saw it with my own eyes. And honestly, I wasn't even told half of it! Your wisdom and greatness far exceed the reports I heard."

verses.kjv: Happy are thy men, and happy are these thy servants, which stand continually before thee, and hear thy wisdom.
verses.web: Happy are your men, and happy are these your servants, who stand continually before you, and hear your wisdom.
verses.ct: "How fortunate your people are! How blessed are these servants of yours who get to stand in your presence every day and listen to your wisdom!

verses.kjv: Blessed be the LORD thy God, which delighted in thee to set thee on his throne, to be king for the LORD thy God: because thy God loved Israel, to establish them for ever, therefore made he thee king over them, to do judgment and justice.
verses.web: Blessed be LORD your God, who delighted in you, to set you on his throne, to be king for LORD your God; because your God loved Israel, to establish them forever. Therefore he made you king over them, to do justice and righteousness.”
verses.ct: Praise the LORD your God, who was so pleased with you that he placed you on his throne to rule on his behalf. Because your God loves Israel and wants to establish them forever, he made you their king to carry out justice and righteousness."

verses.kjv: And she gave the king an hundred and twenty talents of gold, and of spices great abundance, and precious stones: neither was there any such spice as the queen of Sheba gave king Solomon.
verses.web: She gave the king one hundred and twenty talents of gold, spices in great abundance, and precious stones. There was never before such spice as the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
verses.ct: She gave the king 120 talents of gold, an enormous quantity of spices, and precious stones. No one had ever given spices like the ones the queen of Sheba gave to King Solomon.

verses.kjv: And the servants also of Huram, and the servants of Solomon, which brought gold from Ophir, brought algum trees and precious stones.
verses.web: The servants of Huram and the servants of Solomon, who brought gold from Ophir, also brought algum trees and precious stones.
verses.ct: In addition, the servants of Huram and the servants of Solomon who brought gold from Ophir also brought back algum wood and precious stones.

verses.kjv: And the king made of the algum trees terraces to the house of the LORD, and to the king’s palace, and harps and psalteries for singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.
verses.web: The king used algum tree wood to make terraces for LORD’s house and for the king’s house, and harps and stringed instruments for the singers. There were none like these seen before in the land of Judah.
verses.ct: The king used the algum wood to build terraces for the LORD's house and the royal palace, and to craft harps and lyres for the musicians. Nothing like them had ever been seen before in the land of Judah.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatsoever she asked, beside that which she had brought unto the king. So she turned, and went away to her own land, she and her servants.
verses.web: King Solomon gave to the queen of Sheba all her desire, whatever she asked, in addition to that which she had brought to the king. So she turned, and went to her own land, she and her servants.
verses.ct: King Solomon gave the queen of Sheba everything she wanted — whatever she asked for — on top of gifts equal to what she had brought him. Then she and her servants left and returned to her own country.

verses.kjv: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred and threescore and six talents of gold;
verses.web: Now the weight of gold that came to Solomon in one year was six hundred sixty-six talents of gold,
verses.ct: The total weight of gold that came to Solomon in a single year was 666 talents of gold,

verses.kjv: Beside that which chapmen and merchants brought. And all the kings of Arabia and governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
verses.web: in addition to that which the traders and merchants brought. All the kings of Arabia and the governors of the country brought gold and silver to Solomon.
verses.ct: not counting what the traders and merchants brought in. On top of that, all the kings of Arabia and the governors of the surrounding regions brought gold and silver to Solomon.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon made two hundred targets of beaten gold: six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one target.
verses.web: King Solomon made two hundred bucklers of beaten gold. Six hundred shekels of beaten gold went to one buckler.
verses.ct: King Solomon made 200 large shields of hammered gold, with 600 shekels of hammered gold going into each shield.

verses.kjv: And three hundred shields made he of beaten gold: three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield. And the king put them in the house of the forest of Lebanon.
verses.web: He made three hundred shields of beaten gold. Three hundred shekels of gold went to one shield. The king put them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.
verses.ct: He also made 300 smaller shields of hammered gold, using 300 shekels of gold for each one. The king placed them in the House of the Forest of Lebanon.

verses.kjv: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
verses.web: Moreover the king made a great throne of ivory, and overlaid it with pure gold.
verses.ct: The king also built a magnificent throne made of ivory and overlaid with pure gold.

verses.kjv: And there were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and stays on each side of the sitting place, and two lions standing by the stays:
verses.web: There were six steps to the throne, with a footstool of gold, which were fastened to the throne, and armrests on either side by the place of the seat, and two lions standing beside the armrests.
verses.ct: The throne had 6 steps leading up to it, with a gold footstool attached to it. There were armrests on both sides of the seat, and 2 lions stood beside the armrests.

verses.kjv: And twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other upon the six steps. There was not the like made in any kingdom.
verses.web: Twelve lions stood there on the one side and on the other on the six steps. There was nothing like it made in any other kingdom.
verses.ct: 12 more lions stood on the steps, one on each side of every step. Nothing like it had ever been made in any other kingdom.

verses.kjv: And all the drinking vessels of king Solomon were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was not any thing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
verses.web: All king Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were of pure gold. Silver was not considered valuable in the days of Solomon.
verses.ct: Every one of King Solomon's drinking cups was made of gold, and all the vessels in the House of the Forest of Lebanon were pure gold. Silver wasn't even considered valuable during Solomon's reign.

verses.kjv: For the king’s ships went to Tarshish with the servants of Huram: every three years once came the ships of Tarshish bringing gold, and silver, ivory, and apes, and peacocks.
verses.web: For the king had ships that went to Tarshish with Huram’s servants. Once every three years, the ships of Tarshish came bringing gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.
verses.ct: The king had ships that sailed to Tarshish with Huram's crew. Once every 3 years, the Tarshish fleet would return carrying gold, silver, ivory, apes, and peacocks.

verses.kjv: And king Solomon passed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
verses.web: So king Solomon exceeded all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.
verses.ct: King Solomon surpassed every other king on earth in both wealth and wisdom.

verses.kjv: And all the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, that God had put in his heart.
verses.web: All the kings of the earth sought the presence of Solomon, to hear his wisdom, which God had put in his heart.
verses.ct: Kings from all over the world sought an audience with Solomon to hear the wisdom that God had placed in his heart.

verses.kjv: And they brought every man his present, vessels of silver, and vessels of gold, and raiment, harness, and spices, horses, and mules, a rate year by year.
verses.web: They each brought tribute, vessels of silver, vessels of gold, clothing, armor, spices, horses, and mules every year.
verses.ct: Each of them brought tribute year after year — silver and gold vessels, clothing, armor, spices, horses, and mules.

verses.kjv: And Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen; whom he bestowed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.web: Solomon had four thousand stalls for horses and chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen, that he stationed in the chariot cities, and with the king at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Solomon had 4,000 stalls for his horses and chariots, along with 12,000 horsemen. He stationed them in the chariot cities and with him in Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And he reigned over all the kings from the river even unto the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt.
verses.web: He ruled over all the kings from the River even to the land of the Philistines, and to the border of Egypt.
verses.ct: He ruled over all the kings from the Euphrates River to the land of the Philistines and all the way to the border of Egypt.

verses.kjv: And the king made silver in Jerusalem as stones, and cedar trees made he as the sycomore trees that are in the low plains in abundance.
verses.web: The king made silver as common in Jerusalem as stones, and he made cedars to be as abundant as the sycamore trees that are in the lowland.
verses.ct: The king made silver as common as stones in Jerusalem, and cedar wood as plentiful as the sycamore trees in the lowlands.

verses.kjv: And they brought unto Solomon horses out of Egypt, and out of all lands.
verses.web: They brought horses for Solomon out of Egypt and out of all lands.
verses.ct: Horses were imported for Solomon from Egypt and from every other land.

verses.kjv: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, are they not written in the book of Nathan the prophet, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer against Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
verses.web: Now the rest of the acts of Solomon, first and last, aren’t they written in the history of Nathan the prophet, and in the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and in the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam the son of Nebat?
verses.ct: Everything else Solomon did, from beginning to end, is recorded in the writings of Nathan the prophet, the prophecy of Ahijah the Shilonite, and the visions of Iddo the seer concerning Jeroboam son of Nebat.

verses.kjv: And Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
verses.web: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel forty years.
verses.ct: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel for 40 years.

verses.kjv: And Solomon slept with his fathers, and he was buried in the city of David his father: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his stead.
verses.web: Solomon slept with his fathers, and he was buried in his father David’s city: and Rehoboam his son reigned in his place.
verses.ct: He died and was buried in the city of David, his father's city. His son Rehoboam became king after him.
